result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Orlando A Haynes

[MK] cases #22CF202, #22TR2673, #22TR2674, #22TR2675 called at 3:30pm 
Defendant Orlando A Haynes in court with Attorney Joseph Fischer.  ADA Krysta Parson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
These cases are scheduled for Final Status Conference/Final Pretrial Conference today, and for trial next week.  However the State has filed a Motion to Adjourn because it has been learned that the officer-witness is not available next week. 
Attorney Fischer indicates that the Defense is taking no position on the adjournment request. 
The Court grants the adjournment request. The Court informs the parties that the trial in February will be before Judge Hue/Branch II. 
recess 3:35pm.  

NEXT:  (1) FSSC and Final Pretrial on February 14th at 2:30pm,  (2) Jury Trial and Court Trials on February 20th at 8:45am

[ma] Case called at 2:40pm {This hearing is being conducted via Zoom videoconferencing.}
Defendant Orlando A Haynes appears. Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer appears .  Michael C. Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
The Court finds that the Zoom video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Mr. Haynes waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charge and maximum penalties are recited
--plea of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess: 2:47pm

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Joseph Francis Fischer

[MK] case called at 1:23pm 
Defendant Orlando A Haynes appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Attorney Joseph Fischer. ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
The Defense requests the scheduling of Preliminary Hearing within the time limit, however the Defense then agrees to scheduling on May 9th at 2:15pm.  The Court finds good cause for extension of the time limit.
The Court requires a $5,000 Cash Bond with no special conditions.
recess 1:33pm. 

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on May 9th at 2:15pm
